meanings.definition: To give up or surrender something
meanings.sent1: She relinquished her seat on the bus to the elderly lady.
meanings.sent2: He relinquished his claim to the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent3: The cat relinquished its hold on the toy mouse, allowing the dog to play with it.
meanings.sent4: The sun relinquished its grip on the sky as night fell.
meanings.sent5: The knight relinquished his sword in defeat, signaling the end of the battle.

meanings.definition: To release or let go of something
meanings.sent1: The magician relinquished the dove from his hand, stunning the audience.
meanings.sent2: She relinquished her worries and felt a sense of peace wash over her.
meanings.sent3: The tree relinquished its leaves in the autumn breeze, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The athlete relinquished the baton to the next runner in the relay race.
meanings.sent5: The teacher relinquished control of the classroom to the substitute for the day.
